translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: King Ajātasattu of Magadha wishes to invade the Vajjians, and sends his minister Vassakāra to tell the Buddha of his intentions. The Buddha recalls the time he taught the seven principles of non-decline to the Vajjians.

translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The Buddha tells of hearing the seven principles of non-decline from a god. Sāriputta offers additional explanation.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When a friend has seven factors, one should associate with them.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When a mendicant has seven factors, one should stay close to them even if they send you away.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: With seven qualities, a mendicant will soon realize the four kinds of textual analysis.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: With seven qualities, Sāriputta realized the four kinds of textual analysis.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Seven qualities leading to mastery of meditation.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: With seven qualities, Sāriputta became a master of meditation.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Sāriputta visits a sectarian hermitage and hears them saying that someone who lives the spiritual life for twelve years is fit to graduate. The Buddha rejects this, saying that a mendicant is qualified to graduate not merely by completing a certain number of years, but because of their spiritual qualities.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation
SV theravada.ru
translations.title: Сутта Основания для Без десяти Первая

blurb: Ānanda visits a sectarian hermitage and hears them saying that someone who lives the spiritual life for twelve years is fit to graduate. The Buddha rejects this, saying that a mendicant is qualified to graduate not merely by completing a certain number of years, but because of their spiritual qualities.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation
SV theravada.ru
translations.title: Сутта Основания для Без десяти Вторая

translated_title: The Chapter on a Great Sacrifice

blurb: Seven planes of consciousness in which beings may be reborn.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The path factors are the prerequisite for right immersion.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Seven fires, some physical, some psychological.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The brahmin Uggatasarīra has arranged a great sacrifice. On Ānanda’s advice, he asks the Buddha how to make a sacrifice beneficial.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Meditating on seven perceptions leads to the deathless, in brief.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Meditating on seven perceptions leads to the deathless, in detail.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The brahmin Jāṇussoṇī asks the Buddha about behaviors that are a blemish to the celibate life.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: By focusing on their own gendered attributes, a man or woman becomes attached to them and develops lust for the opposite sex.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The lay followers of Campā seek a teaching from the Buddha. Together with Sāriputta, they ask the Buddha about what makes a gift fruitful.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Sāriputta and Moggallāna are on tour in the southern hills. A deity informs the laywoman Veḷukaṇṭakī that they are approaching. When Sāriputta expresses his amazement that she speaks with the gods, she goes on to list many other of her own amazing qualities.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

translated_title: The Chapter on the Undeclared Points

blurb: The Buddha explains why a noble disciple has no doubt when it comes to the unexplained points.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Seven kinds of rebirth for non-returners, as well as extinguishment by not grasping.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Two gods come to the Buddha on Vulture’s Peak and declare that the nuns are liberated. Moggallāna interrogates one of the deities on what he means, and the Buddha adds further explanation.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The Buddha explains the benefits of giving that are visible in the present life, and one that is only apparent in the next.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Four areas where the Realized One has nothing to hide, and three ways he is irreproachable.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Venerable Kimbila asks the Buddha the reasons for the long-lasting of Buddhism after the Buddha’s demise.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Qualities required for arahantship.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Before his awakening, Moggallāna is struggling with sleepiness in meditation. The Buddha visits him and gives seven ways to dispel drowsiness, and other important teachings.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The incalculable benefits of merit that last for many aeons.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Anāthapiṇḍika’s home was in an uproar due to the badly behaved Sujātā, newly wedded to one of his sons. The Buddha speaks to her on the different kinds of wives.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When someone is angry, they wish ill upon their enemy, and are disappointed if they do well. This sutta includes a powerful set of verses.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A sense of conscience is the foundation that leads step by step to liberation.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A rare discourse on cosmic evolution. The Buddha describes the successive appearance of seven suns and how even the earth will be burned up.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: When a king’s fortress is well supplied with seven things and has four kinds of food supplies it is impregnable. Similarly, a noble disciple with seven qualities and the four absorptions is impregnable.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: A mendicant who has seven qualities is worthy, with a special emphasis on listening to and learning the teaching.

translations.author: Thanissaro Bhikkhu
translations.title: One With a Sense of Dhamma

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: The blossoming of the Shady Orchid Tree delights the gods of the Thirty-Three, and in the same way, the renunciation of a Buddhist ascetic is delightful.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Sāriputta reflects on what a mendicant should revere in order to develop the wholesome. He reports to the Buddha that these things are indeed found in himself.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Liberation doesn’t happen because you wish for it, but because you develop the path.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: It would be better for a monk to embrace a blazing fire than to lie with a maiden.
translated_title: The Simile of the Great Mass of Fire

translations.author: Bhikkhu Sujato
translations.title: The Simile of the Great Mass of Fire

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: There have been many great teachers in the past, who should not be reviled. But reviling a single noble disciple is even more serious.

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation

blurb: Araka was a famous teacher long ago, when the life span was much greater than today. Nevertheless, he still taught impermanence; how much more is it relevant today!

translations.lang_name: မြန်မာဘာသာ
translations.author: Pitaka Myanmar Translation
